newsitem.title: USA: NYS unemploment rate at 5.7 percent in October.
newsitem.headline: NYS unemploment rate at 5.7 percent in October.

text.p: New York State Labor Department reported the unemployment rate remained at 5.7 percent in October after falling below 6.0 percent in September for the first time in six years.
In addition, the department reported that the number of umemployed persons in New York was below 500,000 for the second month in a row.
The number of non-farm jobs increased by 61,000 from September to October or about 10,000 more than the usual for this time of the year.
"The job count continued to expand in October and the unemployment rate was at its lowest level since 1990," said Thomas Rodick, director of Division of Research and Statistics.

By county, Tompkins at 2.9 percent, Yates at 2.9 percent and Columbia at 2.9 percent had the lowest October 1996 unemployment rates in the state. The highest rates occured in the Bronx County at 10.6 percent and Kings County at 9.2 percent.
New York City unemployment rate for Octoober was 8.6 percent, up from 8.0 percent in September, the report said.
